  • Method Details

    • getRoad

      public Road getRoad​(int x, int y)

      public Building getBuilding​(int x, int y)

    • addRoad

      public boolean addRoad​(int roadRow, int roadColumn, PlayerColor color) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a road for the player to the given index. The indices works such that the progression is left to right for columns, top to bottom for rows. Even rows indicate rows of horizontal zig zag roads and odd rows indicated rows of vertical boards. Roads must be adjacent to another road/building of the same color.
      Parameters:
      roadRow - the row index for where to place the road
      roadColumn - the column index for where to place the road
      color - the color of the player who is placing the road
      Returns:
      true if the road was successfully placed, false otherwise (assuming no errors are thrown)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - row or column are outside of the range of valid indices

    • addBuilding

      public boolean addBuilding​(int buildingRow, int buildingColumn, PlayerColor color) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a building for the player to the given index. The indices works such that the progression is left to right for columns, top to bottom for rows. The columns in a given row follow the horizontal zig zag of the rows. Buildings must be adjacent to another road of the same color. Buildings must be
      Parameters:
      buildingRow - the row index for where to place the building
      buildingColumn - the column index for where to place the building
      color - the color of the player who is placing the building
      Returns:
      true if the building was successfully placed, false otherwise (assuming no errors are thrown)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - row or column are outside of the range of valid indices

    • addBuildingInit

      public boolean addBuildingInit​(int buildingRow, int buildingColumn, PlayerColor color) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a building for the player to the given index. The indices works such that the progression is left to right for columns, top to bottom for rows. The columns in a given row follow the horizontal zig zag of the rows. Buildings created by this function do NOT have to be placed adjacent to an already placed road.
      Parameters:
      buildingRow - the row index for where to place the building
      buildingColumn - the column index for where to place the building
      color - the color of the player who is placing the building
      Returns:
      true if the building was successfully placed, false otherwise (assuming no errors are thrown)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - row or column are outside of the range of valid indices

    • upgradeBuilding

      public boolean upgradeBuilding​(int buildingRow, int buildingColumn)
      Upgrades the building at the given index from a settlement to a city. If there isn't a building placed there or the building has already been upgraded, false is returned.
      Parameters:
      buildingRow - the row index for where to upgrade the building
      buildingColumn - the column index for where to upgrade the building
      Returns:
      true if the building was successfully upgraded, false otherwise (assuming no errors are thrown)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - row or column are outside of the range of valid indices

    • processTurn

      public java.util.ArrayList<Tuple<ResourceCard,​PlayerColor>> processTurn​(int rollValue)
      Processes a turn based on the given dice roll, gets list of cards and players to send them to
      Parameters:
      rollValue - the dice roll generated
      Returns:
      a list resource cards and the corresponding players to give them to
